result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Scott Cretilli

records.addlTxt: Informational/No Action Required - Restitution Worksheet, filed by DA's Office. mw
filed by DE. olg    To RG

3:47 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: C Dillon via Zoom, Clerk: J Foley, Defendant Thomas Scott Cretilli in court, pro se.  Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. DE continues to waive his right to an atty. DE states he did not receive the state's offer. Court notes matter proceeds to trial. Cut off for negotiations on 11/4/22 by 4 pm. Adjourned: 3:54 pm. jaf
Filed by DE. ec: DA. kma    to rg

Clerk received call from DE inquiring how to receive discovery and stating that he is representing himself. Clerk reviews notes from JA on 10/19 regarding mailing Petition for Court Appointed Attorney to DE to complete. DE stated that he received the PFAC but wishes to represent himself. Clerk advised that he can file a Demand for Discovery and may need to formally waive right to counsel if he has not already done so for the DA to speak directly to him. DE indicated that he would file something with the Clerk's office today regarding request for discovery. kma

JA called Def. to inquire about the status of an attorney. Def. indicated he does not qualify for the P.D. JA mailed him a blank PFAC and instructed him to complete and send back to Clerk's Office ASAP. RJG
22R 012098 posted by def: Thomas Scott Cretilli. mw

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, E. Lindstrom and K. Grass.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

Defendant may retrieve personal belongings from the residence in the presence of law enforcement ONLY. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:55 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Thomas Scott Cretilli in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Thomas Scott Cretilli.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. DE updates address.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Bond argument.  Court orders bond.  DE requesting to have speedy Jury Trial.  FPT will be cut off for negotiations.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Jury trial on November 14, 2022 at 08:00 am.
